Dialogue:
DM: Good evening.  
BP: Good evening. How can I assist you?  
DM: Have you bought anything recently?  
BP: Yes, a neck cooler.  
DM: What is that?  
BP: It provides a cool sensation when chilled.  
DM: Made from special material?  
BP: Yes, uses material from space with a coolant pack.  
DM: Interesting. Where can I get one?  
BP: You can buy one for about 1000 yen on Qoo10.  
DM: Is it reusable?  
BP: Yes, solidifies quickly in the refrigerator and is semi-permanent. Best used indoors or on a balcony.  
DM: Does it stay cool in hot areas?  
BP: Stays cool for about two hours. For outdoors, use a cooling towel or patch.  
DM: Can it help with electricity costs?  
BP: Yes, it helps when you don't want to turn on the air conditioner.  
DM: My electricity bill is high lately.  
BP: Prices have increased recently.  
DM: Going out is expensive too.  
BP: Public facilities like libraries or malls are good alternatives.  
DM: I went to the mall today; it was crowded.  
BP: Yes, crowds are common. Driving adds fuel costs, and you might make purchases.  
DM: I always end up buying unnecessary things.  
BP: That happens to many.  
DM: I like books and often buy them at bookstores.  
BP: Libraries are a good option; I borrow books now.  
DM: Libraries are convenient but hard to get popular books.  
BP: You can reserve books, though it might take time.  
DM: Makes you want to read it immediately.  
BP: Indeed. Anything else you need?  
DM: No, that's all. Thank you.  
BP: You're welcome. Have a great evening!

DM: Good evening.
BP: Good evening.
DM: Thank you.
BP: Have you had dinner?
DM: Not yet.
BP: Are you hungry? Are you okay?
DM: Lunch was late, so I'm managing.
BP: We made ratatouille with zucchini.
DM: Summer vegetables are great.
BP: They prevent summer fatigue and colds.
DM: Seasonal vegetables taste good.
BP: Yes, and a pressure cooker makes it quick.
DM: Does it usually take long?
BP: It needs simmering, which takes time.
DM: I made corn rice recently.
BP: Did you use a rice cooker?
DM: Yes, with fresh corn.
BP: I might try that.
DM: Put the corn core in.
BP: I thought you just use kernels.
DM: The broth comes from the core.
BP: I'll try it. Thanks.
DM: What other summer vegetables are there?
BP: Tomatoes, eggplants, okra, bitter melons.
DM: I like tomatoes. How do you eat them?
BP: Fresh or in ratatouille.
DM: Fresh tomatoes are better than canned.
BP: Vegetables are pricey but worth it.
DM: Be careful of summer fatigue.
BP: Take care.

DM: Good evening, thank you.

BP: You’re welcome. How can I assist you today?

DM: Do you like movies?

BP: Yes, I enjoy movies and usually watch them on Amazon Prime.

DM: That's nice. You don't go to movie theaters much, do you?

BP: I like them but haven’t had the chance. Last I saw were Aladdin, Frozen 2, and Kaguya-sama's finale.

DM: I also watched Aladdin. Wasn't it romantic?

BP: Different from the anime but visually impressive.

DM: I go often since a theater is close to me.

BP: That sounds convenient. I plan to see Tang this summer.

DM: Ninomiya-kun's acting is good, isn't it?

BP: Yes, his acting in "My Family" was excellent.

DM: Do you have a favorite actor?

BP: Recently, Shun Oguri.

DM: Shun Oguri is cool.

BP: I saw his life-sized photos at Izu Taiga Drama Museum.

DM: Whose story is the current Taiga drama about?

BP: The Kamakura shogunate, Shun Oguri plays Yoshitoki.

DM: The Taiga drama is informative, isn't it?

BP: Yes, I also watch explanation videos on YouTube for better understanding.

DM: I can't keep up with too many characters.

BP: This drama involves many Kamakura Shogunate characters.

DM: A must-watch on YouTube. Which movie have you enjoyed most recently in the theater?

BP: I'm curious about Kingdom 2. Was it impressive?

DM: Yes, it's best seen in the theater. Amazing impact.

BP: Kingdom sounds great for the theater.

DM: I watch action movies at the theater, others at home.

BP: That makes sense.

DM: Hello  
CN: Hello  
DM: What time did you wake up today?  
CN: I woke up at 8 o'clock.  
DM: That’s early.  
CN: I took a nap afterward.  
DM: Noted. I can't sleep at night if I nap.  
CN: What time did you get up today?  
DM: I woke up at 10 o'clock.  
CN: Is that usual on weekends?  
DM: On weekdays, I get up at 7 o'clock. On days off, I sleep in.  
CN: Understood.  
DM: The bad weather made me stay in bed longer today.  
CN: I got up because it was garbage day.  
DM: Missing trash day is inconvenient.  
CN: I didn’t put out the recycling due to rain last night.  
DM: You’re diligent. Some people put out trash regardless.  
CN: Wet cardboard isn’t ideal to put out.  
DM: I need to sort my cardboard too.  
CN: Cardboard piles up quickly.  
DM: I wait until I have enough to tie up before disposing.  
CN: It tends to accumulate.  
DM: I enjoy tying up the cardboard.  
CN: That’s organized. I struggle with it.  
DM: It’s satisfying because it’s challenging.  
CN: Any tips for doing it nicely?  
DM: Tighten it firmly and frequently.  
CN: I’ll try that.  
DM: Conversation ended.  
CN: Understood.

DM: Hello  
CN: Hello  
DM: What do you do on your days off?  
CN: Read books and do housework.  
DM: You read books!  
CN: Yes, but not much.  
DM: One or two books a month?  
CN: Yes.  
DM: That's great!  
CN: It can be tiring.  
DM: Long periods or bit by bit?  
CN: Bit by bit for business books.  
DM: Does genre change how you read?  
CN: Novels all at once.  
DM: Interesting stories draw you in.  
CN: Especially horror or mystery.  
DM: Easy to forget characters over time.  
CN: Yes.  
DM: I watch Netflix on holidays.  
CN: Movies or dramas?  
DM: Both, and anime.  
CN: Found anything interesting?  
DM: "Aoashi," a soccer anime.  
CN: Interesting.  
DM: Do you know it?  
CN: Yes, it's good.  
DM: One of the best boys' manga.  
CN: I'll check it out.  
DM: Please do.  
CN: OK.

DM: Good evening.
HJ: Good evening.
DM: It's cooler these days.
HJ: Yes, today is a bit hot.
DM: Still warm during the day, right?
HJ: Yes, we need the fan.
DM: Did you use a fan all summer?
HJ: I used the air conditioner too.
DM: I used an air conditioner and a circulator.
HJ: What is a circulator?
DM: It helps save electricity.
HJ: How much did you save?
DM: About 1000 yen.
HJ: Is a circulator expensive?
DM: Around 3,000 yen.
HJ: Does it work well?
DM: Yes, it improves efficiency.
HJ: How large is your room?
DM: About 9 tatami mats.
HJ: Did it still help?
DM: Yes, I didn't need the air conditioner every day.
HJ: Should you avoid turning it on and off frequently?
DM: Yes, keep it on for short outings.
HJ: I haven't checked this summer's bill yet.
DM: That can be concerning.
HJ: Yes, I used the air conditioner a lot.
DM: It's hard to stay comfortable without it.
HJ: Definitely, I always had it on.
DM: I relied on the air conditioner without opening windows.
HJ: Understood.

DM: Hello!  
HJ: Hello.  
DM: It's already October, but do you have any memories from this summer?  
HJ: I went on a trip.  
DM: That sounds wonderful! Where did you go?  
HJ: Shikoku and Ishikawa area, for example.  
DM: I’m really jealous! I've never been there.  
HJ: Is that so! You don't travel much?  
DM: I do enjoy traveling, but I tend to stay nearby.  
HJ: Did you go anywhere this summer?  
DM: I went to Atami!  
HJ: Sounds good! Did you visit the sea?  
DM: Yes! I enjoyed the sea and some delicious food!  
HJ: Does Atami have any local specialties?  
DM: I bought items like salted fish and dried fish for my friend.  
HJ: That sounds pretty good. It seems like it would make a good snack to go with alcohol.  
DM: Absolutely. I ended up drinking quite a bit while I was there.  
HJ: Hahaha. Did you go to a bar?  
DM: Yes, I visited a seafood bar.  
HJ: That’s the place! It seems popular with young people.  
DM: Indeed, there were many. The seafood bowl was incredibly delicious.  
HJ: A seafood bowl sounds great.  
DM: And I drank highballs until I was drenched.  
HJ: Oh! Do you like highballs?  
DM: I do! But I can't drink them straight.  
HJ: I like them too. I enjoy variations like coke highballs.  
DM: That’s fantastic! Whoever came up with that was really smart.  
HJ: No doubt about it! It’s easy to drink, isn’t it?  
DM: I tend to drink too much.  
HJ: I understand.

DM: Hello!  
HJ: Hello.  
DM: What do you do on your days off?  
HJ: I visit the hot springs.  
DM: Is it nearby?  
HJ: Yes, it's quite large.  
DM: That sounds great, I'm so envious!  
HJ: There's also a waterfall.  
DM: That sounds wonderful.  
HJ: That's correct. There are also several saunas.  
DM: Is it usually crowded?  
HJ: It's busy during holidays.  
DM: I also enjoy going to public baths.  
HJ: Is it close by?  
DM: Yes, within about 1 kilometer.  
HJ: That sounds convenient. Do you like saunas?  
DM: I've recently started enjoying them.  
HJ: Saunas are gaining popularity.  
DM: I've noticed a trend. My local place is often busy.  
HJ: I understand. Saunas can be crowded.  
DM: Is it safe during the COVID-19 pandemic?  
HJ: If we're already in the same bath, it might be okay.  
DM: It's surprising that it doesn't turn into a cluster. Do you use the sauna often?  
HJ: I do, but not for extended periods.  
DM: I can last about 10 minutes.  
HJ: Even 10 minutes is impressive. I can only manage around 5 minutes.  
DM: Maybe my place has a lower temperature. Do you have good metabolism?  
HJ: That might be the case. I get dizzy quickly.  
DM: A friend of mine fainted from overexertion, so be careful.  
HJ: That's concerning. I'll make sure to be cautious.
